description:
Presence of children

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
12211 Microcensus

Definition:
Never-married persons without a life partner and with no
children of their own in the household who live in a family
with at least one parent. In addition to natural children,
stepchildren, adopted and foster children are also regarded
as children in the microcensus provided that the above
conditions are met. In principle, there is no age limit for
being counted as a child. Children who still live in one
household with their parents but already look after their
own children there, are not never-married anymore or live
with a partner as a cohabiting couple are not regarded as
being part of their family of origin but counted as a
separate family or living arrangement.
